## ğŸ“‹ CORE CONTENT TAGS

### Speculation & Flexibility
- `[SPECULATIVE]` â€” Content generated as possibility, not confirmed canon; user may override
- `[PLAYER-DEFINED]` â€” Content controlled by player choice, not GM fiat
- `[FLEXIBLE]` â€” Content that can change if narrative requires; not locked
- `[CONFIRMED CANON]` â€” Content locked as world truth; cannot be changed without flagging

### Genre & Tone
- `[INTENTIONAL TROPE]` â€” A genre trope used deliberately with awareness (e.g., chosen one structure, but subverted)
- `[TONAL OUTLIER]` â€” Content that deliberately breaks the established genre tone for contrast
- `[INTENTIONAL TONAL CONTRAST]` â€” Deliberate clash between element's tone and dominant world tone

## ğŸ² PLAY HOOKS & ENGAGEMENT

### Hook Types
- `[PLAY HOOK]` â€” Content that creates immediate player engagement opportunity
- `[HOOK TYPE: Chase]` â€” Players must pursue or flee; time and space create pressure
- `[HOOK TYPE: Social]` â€” Players navigate charged relationship or public situation
- `[HOOK TYPE: Investigation]` â€” Players gather and interpret scattered information
- `[HOOK TYPE: Survival]` â€” Players manage limited resources under threat
- `[HOOK TYPE: Moral]` â€” Players choose between options that both cause harm
- `[HOOK TYPE: Heist]` â€” Players plan and execute covert operation
- `[HOOK TYPE: Negotiation]` â€” Players broker agreement between incompatible interests
- `[HOOK TYPE: Discovery]` â€” Players stumble into something not yet part of known tensions
- `[HOOK TYPE: Protection]` â€” Players shield someone/something from active threat
- `[HOOK TYPE: Escalation]` â€” Players decide whether to push situation further

### Hook Dependencies
- `[HOOK INDEPENDENT]` â€” Hook accessible without completing other hooks
- `[HOOK PREREQ: X â€” bypass: Y]` â€” Hook has prerequisite X but can be reached via bypass Y
- `[HOOK CHAIN DEPTH: X â€” bypass at step Y: Z]` â€” Chain depth documentation with bypass paths
- `[HOOK TYPE GAP: X]` â€” Hook type X has not appeared in recent batches; prioritize

## ğŸ“š INFORMATION TIERS & ACCESS

### Information Classification
- `[PUBLIC]` â€” Anyone can know this; no barrier to access
- `[RUMORED]` â€” Circulates imprecisely; may be partially false
- `[RESTRICTED]` â€” Gatekept by faction, institution, or relationship
- `[HIDDEN]` â€” Actively suppressed or known only to specific individuals
- `[LOST]` â€” No living person can verify; requires archaeology/research

### Knowledge Distribution
- `[KNOWLEDGE PATH: Primary]` â€” Main access route to information
- `[KNOWLEDGE PATH: Secondary]` â€” Alternative access route
- `[CONTESTED KNOWLEDGE]` â€” Multiple sources give conflicting versions
- `[ROLEPLAY ACCESS: X â€” no dice required]` â€” Information accessible through in-character action X without skill check
- `[KNOWLEDGE BOTTLENECK: X]` â€” Single NPC monopoly on knowledge (violation â€” needs correction)

**Usage Principle**: Tags make world architecture visible to both the LLM and the GM. They are system metadata â€” rarely read aloud to players, but essential for maintaining world coherence across sessions.
